# Changelog

All notable changes to the Acutrack Design System will be documented in this file.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/),
and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html).

## [1.0.88] - 2026-01-27

### âœ¨ Improvements

#### Sidebar: Hide on Mobile by Default

The Sidebar now **hides on mobile by default** (`hideOnMobile` defaults to `true`). This provides a cleaner mobile experience where the sidebar is off-screen until opened via the hamburger button.

**Breaking Change:**
- **Before**: `hideOnMobile` defaulted to `false` (sidebar visible but collapsed on mobile)
- **After**: `hideOnMobile` defaults to `true` (sidebar hidden on mobile, overlay when opened)

**Migration:**
```tsx
// To show sidebar on mobile (old behavior)
<Sidebar hideOnMobile={false}>
  ...
</Sidebar>

// To use overlay pattern (new default)
<Sidebar 
  hideOnMobile={true}  // or omit (defaults to true)
  mobileOpen={mobileOpen}
  onMobileOpenChange={setMobileOpen}
>
  ...
</Sidebar>
```

#### Sidebar: Mobile Breakpoint Adjusted (767px)

The mobile breakpoint changed from `768px` to `767px` so that tablets like iPad Mini (768px width) show the sidebar instead of hiding it.

- **Before**: Mobile = `(max-width: 768px)` (iPad Mini 768px was treated as mobile)
- **After**: Mobile = `(max-width: 767px)` (iPad Mini 768px shows sidebar)

#### useMediaQuery: Enhanced DevTools Emulator Support

The `useMediaQuery` hook now better detects viewport changes in Chrome DevTools device emulator:

**New Features:**
- **Visual Viewport API**: Listens to `window.visualViewport` `resize` and `scroll` events
- **Orientation Change**: Listens to `window.orientationchange` events
- **Development Polling**: In development mode, re-checks media queries every 800ms to catch emulator dropdown changes that don't fire events

This ensures layout adapts immediately when selecting devices (e.g., iPhone 12) in the emulator without requiring manual resize or orientation toggle.

#### Input & Form Components: Disabled State, Floating Label, Ghost, Primary/Secondary

**Input: Stronger disabled state (all variants + dark mode)**  
- Disabled uses distinct gray background, muted border, dimmed text/placeholder. Label, helper, and left/right icons use reduced opacity (70% / 60%). Dark mode: darker background, dimmer text, container `dark:opacity-85`. Container and input use `cursor-not-allowed` when disabled.

**Input, Textarea, PasswordInput, Select, NumberInput, MultiSelect: `labelMode`**  
- New prop `labelMode?: 'top' | 'floating'` (default `'top'`). `labelMode="floating"` shows the label inside the field; it floats up on focus or when the field has a value. Aligns with DatePicker.

**Ghost variant**  
- Ghost uses transparent border by default; border appears on hover/focus so it is distinct from primary.

**Form components: primary/secondary background**  
- Primary = white (`bg-bg-secondary`). Secondary = light blue (`bg-bg-tertiary`). Applied to Input, Select, Checkbox, Textarea, NumberInput, PasswordInput, MultiSelect, Slider.

**Input: number input border**  
- CSS ensures `input[type="number"]` has a visible solid border and optional spinner hiding so number inputs match text inputs.

---

## [1.0.87] - 2026-01-23

### âœ¨ Improvements

#### Table & VirtualizedTable: Striped Rows (2nd, 4th, 6th...)

Striped rows now apply to the **2nd, 4th, 6th...** data rows. The **first data row** uses the base background for cleaner hierarchy.

- **Table**: `odd:bg-bg-tertiary/50` â†’ `even:bg-bg-tertiary/50`
- **VirtualizedTable**: `(startIndex + index) % 2 === 0` â†’ `(startIndex + index) % 2 === 1` (stripes on 2nd, 4th, 6th...)

---

### ðŸ› Bug Fixes

#### DashboardTestPage: `t()` Return Type (TypeScript)

Fixed `t()` helper so it always returns `string`, resolving `string | null` TypeScript errors for: `Header.Search` `placeholder`, `UserMenu` `links[].label`, `VirtualizedTable` `columns[].header`, and `labelMap` (active, inactive, pending, suspended).

```ts
// Before: getTranslation could return null
t(key, fallback) // string | null

// After: guaranteed string
t(key, fallback): string => getTranslation(...) ?? fallback
```

---

#### Drawer: Panel No Longer Overrides Custom Position/Size

The panelâ€™s base classes no longer include hardcoded position or size. `position`, `size`, `className`, and `style` are now applied as documented and are not overridden by the panel.

**Contributor:** William Stovall (commit 98576bc)

---

#### Sidebar: Safelist `translate-x-0` and `-translate-x-full` for Mobile Overlay

`translate-x-0` and `-translate-x-full` are used dynamically in Sidebar for the mobile overlay slide-in/out. They were added to the Tailwind `safelist` so they are not purged from built CSS when `hideOnMobile` and the mobile overlay are used.

---

## [1.0.86] - 2026-01-13

### âœ¨ New Features

#### Language Selector: Gender & Count Support

Enhanced the `getTranslation()` helper to support **gendered and pluralized translations** for proper internationalization.

**New Parameters:**
- `count?: "singular" | "plural"` - Handle plural forms
- `gender?: "masculine" | "feminine"` - Handle gendered languages (Spanish, French, German, etc.)

**Enhanced I18nTranslator Type:**
```typescript
export type I18nTranslator = {
  [languageCode: string]: {
    [key: string]: string | 
    {
      singular?: string,
      plural?: string
    } | 
    {
      masculine?: string | { singular?: string, plural?: string },
      feminine?: string | { singular?: string, plural?: string },
    };
  };
};
```

**Usage Examples:**
```typescript
// Simple singular/plural
const translation = {
  en: {
    item: { singular: "item", plural: "items" }
  }
};
getTranslation("item", "en", [translation], false, undefined, "plural"); // "items"

// Gendered with plural
const genderedTranslation = {
  es: {
    employee: {
      masculine: { singular: "empleado", plural: "empleados" },
      feminine: { singular: "empleada", plural: "empleadas" }
    }
  }
};
getTranslation("employee", "es", [genderedTranslation], false, undefined, "plural", "feminine"); // "empleadas"
```

---

#### Language Selector: New Variants

Added two new button variants for greater styling flexibility:

| Variant | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `text` | Text-only button style |
| `none` | Ghost style with no default styling (maps to ghost internally) |

**Dark Mode Support:** Added `dark:text-white` class for proper dark theme text visibility.

```tsx
<LanguageSelector 
  language="en" 
  variant="text"    // or "none"
  onLanguageChange={(lang) => setLanguage(lang)} 
/>
```

---

### ðŸ› Bug Fixes

#### Language Helper: Fallback Error Fix

Fixed a critical issue in `getTranslation()` where null/undefined keys could cause errors.

**Changes:**
- Added early null/undefined check for `key` parameter at the start of `getTranslation()`
- Simplified `checkTranslation()` internal function by removing redundant parameters
- Returns empty string instead of the label when count/gender is missing but expected

```typescript
// Before: Could throw error if key was undefined
getTranslation(undefined, "en", [source]); // Error!

// After: Now safely returns null or fallback
getTranslation(undefined, "en", [source]); // Returns null
getTranslation(undefined, "en", [source], true, "Default"); // Returns "Default"
```

**Contributor:** William Stovall

---

## [1.0.85] - 2026-01-08

### ðŸ› Bug Fixes

#### Fixed: Min/Max Date Validation Not Working

**Issue**: The `minDate`/`maxDate` props (passed as `fromDate`/`toDate` to Calendar) only controlled navigation boundaries but did NOT actually disable selection of dates outside the range. Users could still click and select invalid dates.

**Solution**: Implemented `getDisabledMatcher()` function that creates a proper react-day-picker `Matcher` array combining:
- Individual `disabledDates` array
- `{ before: fromDate }` - disables all dates before minDate
- `{ after: toDate }` - disables all dates after maxDate

```tsx
// Calendar.tsx - getDisabledMatcher()
const getDisabledMatcher = useCallback((): Matcher | Matcher[] | undefined => {
  const matchers: Matcher[] = [];
  if (disabledDates?.length > 0) matchers.push(...disabledDates);
  if (fromDate) matchers.push({ before: fromDate });
  if (toDate) matchers.push({ after: toDate });
  return matchers.length === 0 ? undefined : matchers;
}, [disabled, disabledDates, fromDate, toDate]);
```

---

#### Fixed: Calendar Starting at Wrong Month When Min/Max Set

**Issue**: When opening a DatePicker with `maxDate` set to a past date (e.g., 18 years ago for birth date), the calendar would show the current month instead of the valid date range.

**Solution**: Updated `getInitialDisplayDate()` in DatePicker to respect constraints:
- If `maxDate < today` â†’ Start at maxDate's month
- If `minDate > today` â†’ Start at minDate's month
- Otherwise â†’ Start at today's month

---

#### Fixed: Year Picker Range Displayed Backwards

**Issue**: When `endYear < yearRangeStart`, the year picker displayed "2016 - 2008" instead of "2008 - 2016".

**Solution**: Updated year range display and initialization to stay within valid bounds:
```tsx
{Math.max(yearRangeStart, startYear)} - {Math.min(yearRangeStart + 11, endYear)}
```

---

### âœ¨ New Features

#### Flexible Date Input for Min/Max Date Props

`minDate` and `maxDate` props now accept **Date objects OR strings** in various formats for developer convenience.

##### Supported Formats

| Format | Example | Description |
|--------|---------|-------------|
| ISO | `"2024-01-15"` | Year-Month-Day (recommended) |
| US | `"01/15/2024"` | MM/DD/YYYY |
| UK | `"15 Jan 2024"` | DD Mon YYYY |
| Natural | `"January 15, 2024"` | Full month name |
| Date object | `new Date(2024, 0, 15)` | JavaScript Date |

##### Usage Examples

```tsx
// All of these are now valid:
<DatePicker minDate="2024-01-15" maxDate="2025-12-31" />
<DatePicker minDate="01/15/2024" maxDate="12/31/2025" />
<DatePicker minDate="15 Jan 2024" maxDate="31 Dec 2025" />
<DatePicker minDate="January 15, 2024" />
<DatePicker minDate={new Date(2024, 0, 15)} />

// Mix and match!
<DatePicker minDate="2024-01-01" maxDate={new Date()} />
```

##### New Exports

```tsx
import { parseDateInput, DateInput } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';

// Parse any supported format to Date
const date = parseDateInput("01/15/2024"); // Returns Date object
```

---

#### Popover Position Support

DatePicker and DateRangePicker now support the `position` prop to control calendar popover placement.

```tsx
<DatePicker
  position="top-start"    // Opens above the input
/>

<DateRangePicker
  position="bottom-end"   // Opens below, aligned to right
/>
```

##### Available Positions

| Position | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `bottom-start` | Below input, aligned left (default) |
| `bottom` | Below input, centered |
| `bottom-end` | Below input, aligned right |
| `top-start` | Above input, aligned left |
| `top` | Above input, centered |
| `top-end` | Above input, aligned right |

---

### ðŸ“ Documentation

- Added comprehensive Date Constraints section to test page with real-world examples
- Updated DatePicker/DateRangePicker component guides with new props
- Added code examples for flexible date input formats

## [1.0.83] - 2026-01-07

### ðŸ› Bug Fixes: Modern Calendar Navigation in DatePicker

---

#### Fixed: Double-Click Required for Month/Year Selection in DatePicker

**Issue**: When using the DatePicker component with `calendarNavigation="modern"` (Grid Popovers), users had to double-click to select a month or year from the picker grids. The first click was being "swallowed" by event propagation conflicts between the Calendar's internal navigation and the DatePicker's Popover click-outside detection.

**Root Cause**: The Calendar's month/year selection buttons were using `onMouseDown` to trigger selections, which conflicted with the Popover's `useOnClickOutside` hook that also listens on `mousedown`. This caused timing issues where the first click would be consumed by event propagation handling.

**Solution**: Implemented `requestAnimationFrame` pattern for all navigation button actions in the Calendar component. This defers the selection action to the next animation frame, ensuring it executes after React's event processing and the Popover's click-outside detection complete.

##### Files Changed

| File | Changes |
|------|---------|
| `src/components/Calendar.tsx` | Updated 8 button handlers to use `requestAnimationFrame` |
| `src/components/icons.tsx` | Added `data-calendar-nav` check to `useOnClickOutside` hook |

##### Technical Details

```tsx
// Before (required double-click):
onClick={(e) => {
  e.stopPropagation();
  // Action lost to event conflicts
}}
onMouseDown={(e) => {
  e.stopPropagation();
  handleMonthSelect(index);
}}

// After (single-click works):
onClick={(e) => {
  e.stopPropagation();
  e.preventDefault();
  e.nativeEvent.stopImmediatePropagation();
  requestAnimationFrame(() => handleMonthSelect(index));
}}
onMouseDown={(e) => {
  e.stopPropagation();
  e.preventDefault();
  e.nativeEvent.stopImmediatePropagation();
}}
```

##### Components Fixed

- **MonthGridPicker** - Single calendar month selection
- **YearGridPicker** - Single calendar year selection
- **MonthYearButton** - Opens month/year picker popovers
- **Independent Navigation LHS** - Dual calendar left month/year selection
- **Independent Navigation RHS** - Dual calendar right month/year selection

##### Testing Verified

âœ… Single-click opens month picker from Calendar header
âœ… Single-click selects month from grid
âœ… Single-click opens year picker from Calendar header
âœ… Single-click selects year from grid
âœ… Works in both single and dual calendar modes
âœ… Works with all navigation styles (dropdown, modern, buttons)

## [1.0.82] - 2026-01-06

### ðŸŽ‰ Major Refactor: Complete Calendar System Overhaul + DatePicker/DateRangePicker Industry-Standard Upgrade

---

#### ðŸ“… DatePicker & DateRangePicker - Industry-Standard Upgrade

**Complete modernization of form date inputs with industry-standard patterns matching Material Design, Chakra UI, and other leading design systems.**

##### New Input Field Variants

| Variant | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `outline` | Standard bordered input (default) |
| `filled` | Filled background, no border |
| `underline` | Material Design style - bottom border only |
| `flushed` | Edge-to-edge bottom border |
| `ghost` | Transparent until hover |

```tsx
<DatePicker inputVariant="filled" label="Select Date" />
```

##### New Label Position Modes

| Mode | Description |
|------|-------------|
| `top` | Traditional label above input (default) |
| `floating` | Animated label floats up on focus |
| `inside` | Label starts inside, animates up |
| `inline` | Label inline with input |
| `none` | No label, placeholder only |

```tsx
<DatePicker labelMode="floating" label="Birth Date" />
```

##### New State Management

- `isError` - Red border + error icon + error message
- `isSuccess` - Green border + checkmark + success message
- `isDisabled` - Grayed out, not clickable
- `isLoading` - Pulse animation + spinner

```tsx
<DatePicker
  isError
  errorMessage="Please select a future date"
/>
```

##### New Helper Text Support

- `helperText` - Info text below input
- `errorMessage` - Shows when `isError={true}`
- `successMessage` - Shows when `isSuccess={true}`

##### Custom Date Formatting

**Industry-standard date formatting with presets and custom patterns using `date-fns`.**

| Preset | Output Example |
|--------|----------------|
| `short` | 1/6/26 |
| `medium` | Jan 6, 2026 (default) |
| `long` | January 6, 2026 |
| `full` | Monday, January 6, 2026 |
| `iso` | 2026-01-06 |
| `us` | 01/06/2026 |
| `eu` | 06/01/2026 |
| `uk` | 06 Jan 2026 |

```tsx
// Using presets
<DatePicker dateFormat="long" />
<DatePicker dateFormat="iso" />

// Using custom date-fns format strings
<DatePicker dateFormat="dd/MM/yyyy" />
<DatePicker dateFormat="MMMM do, yyyy" />

// Using custom format function
<DatePicker dateFormat={(date) => `Week ${getWeek(date)}, ${date.getFullYear()}`} />
```

##### Full Calendar Integration

All Calendar design system props now pass through:
- `calendarVariant` - solid, soft, outline, minimal, glass
- `calendarNavigation` - dropdown, modern, buttons
- `calendarSize`, `calendarDensity`, `calendarRadius`
- `showWeekNumber`, `weekStartsOn`, `fromYear`, `toYear`

##### DateRangePicker Enhancements

- Full integration with Calendar `mode="range"`
- Preset ranges: Today, This Week, Last 7 Days, This Month, Last Month, Last 30 Days, This Quarter
- `adjustable` and `draggable` props for interactive range modification
- `independentNavigation` for dual calendar mode

---

**Complete modernization of the Calendar component with comprehensive design system architecture, multi-mode selection, and industry-standard UX patterns.**

#### ðŸš€ Breaking Changes
- **Removed `CalendarGridView` component** - This component is no longer needed as `react-day-picker` provides built-in functionality
- **New Calendar API** - The Calendar component now uses a modern, cleaner API with react-day-picker v9 foundation

#### âœ¨ New Design System Architecture

**5 Visual Variants:**
- `solid` - Filled background with white text (default)
- `soft` - Light tinted background with accent text
- `outline` - Transparent with accent border
- `minimal` - Subtle styling with underline indicator
- `glass` - Glassmorphism effect with transparency and blur

**7 Semantic Colors:**
- `primary` - Brand teal/cyan
- `secondary` - Brand navy slate (new dark mode optimized)
- `success` - Green tones
- `warning` - Orange/amber tones
- `danger` - Red tones
- `info` - Blue tones
- `neutral` - Gray tones

**5 Size Options:**
- `xs` - Extra small (compact)
- `sm` - Small
- `md` - Medium (default)
- `lg` - Large
- `xl` - Extra large

**4 Density Options:**
- `compact` - Minimal padding
- `comfortable` - Balanced spacing (default)
- `spacious` - More breathing room
- `relaxed` - Maximum spacing

**6 Border Radius Options:**
- `none`, `sm`, `md`, `lg`, `xl`, `full`

#### ðŸŽ¯ Multi-Mode Selection (Industry Standard)

**Single Mode:**
```tsx
<Calendar
  mode="single"
  value={selectedDate}
  onDateSelect={setSelectedDate}
/>
```

**Range Mode with State-Based Interaction:**
```tsx
<Calendar
  mode="range"
  rangeValue={selectedRange}
  onRangeSelect={setSelectedRange}
  adjustable={true}
  draggable={true}
/>
```

**Multiple Mode:**
```tsx
<Calendar
  mode="multiple"
  multiValue={selectedDates}
  onMultiSelect={setSelectedDates}
/>
```

#### ðŸŽ¨ Range Selection Features

**Industry-Standard 3-State Interaction Flow:**
- **State 0** (Clean Slate): First click sets Start Date
- **State 1** (Start Selected): Hover shows preview; Second click sets End Date
- **State 2** (Complete Range): Third click resets and sets new Start Date

**Advanced Range Features:**
- **Hover Preview**: Visual preview of potential range while hovering
- **Click Before Start**: Automatically swaps dates (smart ordering)
- **Click Same Date**: Clears selection (undo functionality)
- **Adjustable Ends**: Click to extend/shrink range after selection
- **Draggable Handles**: Drag start/end dates to adjust range
- **Cross-Calendar Selection**: Works seamlessly in dual calendar mode

**Variant-Specific Range Styling:**
- Each variant has distinct start/end vs middle date styling
- Soft variant: Solid accent for start/end, light tint for middle
- Outline variant: Solid accent for start/end, transparent with border for middle
- Minimal variant: Underline indicator for start/end
- Glass variant: Glassmorphism with dashed borders for middle dates

#### ðŸ“… Navigation Styles

**4 Navigation Options:**
- `modern` - Month/Year grid popovers with smooth transitions
- `dropdown` - Native select dropdowns for month/year
- `buttons` - Text labels with navigation arrows only
- `default` - Standard navigation with dropdowns

#### ðŸ”„ Dual Calendar Mode

**Display two months side-by-side for better range selection:**
```tsx
<Calendar
  mode="range"
  numberOfMonths={2}
  independentNavigation={true}
  rangeValue={selectedRange}
  onRangeSelect={setSelectedRange}
/>
```

**Independent Navigation Features:**
- Each calendar has its own month/year controls
- Individual navigation arrows for each calendar
- Respects navigation style (modern, dropdown, buttons)
- Cross-calendar range selection works seamlessly

#### ðŸŽ¨ Visual Improvements

- **4px Border Radius** on middle range dates for softer appearance
- **Grab Handles** visible on start/end dates for draggable mode
- **Consistent Hover States** across all navigation styles
- **Dark Mode Optimized**: Secondary color now uses brand navy 500 for better visibility
- **Glass Variant**: Proper transparency with readable text and dashed borders

#### ðŸ“‹ New Calendar Props

| Prop | Type | Description |
|------|------|-------------|
| `mode` | `'single' \| 'range' \| 'multiple'` | Selection mode |
| `variant` | `'solid' \| 'soft' \| 'outline' \| 'minimal' \| 'glass'` | Visual style |
| `color` | `'primary' \| 'secondary' \| 'success' \| 'warning' \| 'danger' \| 'info' \| 'neutral'` | Color theme |
| `size` | `'xs' \| 'sm' \| 'md' \| 'lg' \| 'xl'` | Calendar size |
| `density` | `'compact' \| 'comfortable' \| 'spacious' \| 'relaxed'` | Spacing density |
| `radius` | `'none' \| 'sm' \| 'md' \| 'lg' \| 'xl' \| 'full'` | Border radius |
| `navigation` | `'default' \| 'modern' \| 'dropdown' \| 'buttons'` | Navigation style |
| `numberOfMonths` | `number` | Number of months to display |
| `independentNavigation` | `boolean` | Independent controls for each calendar |
| `adjustable` | `boolean` | Allow adjusting range ends by clicking |
| `draggable` | `boolean` | Allow dragging range ends |
| `rangeValue` | `DateRange` | Selected range (for range mode) |
| `onRangeSelect` | `(range: DateRange \| undefined) => void` | Range selection callback |
| `multiValue` | `Date[]` | Selected dates (for multiple mode) |
| `onMultiSelect` | `(dates: Date[]) => void` | Multiple selection callback |
| `elevated` | `boolean` | Add shadow elevation |
| `bordered` | `boolean` | Add border |
| `animated` | `boolean` | Enable smooth transitions |
| `highlightToday` | `boolean` | Highlight today's date |
| `showOutsideDays` | `boolean` | Show days outside current month |
| `showWeekNumber` | `boolean` | Show week numbers |

### Dependencies Added
- `react-day-picker` v9.13.0
- `date-fns` v3.6.0

### Migration Guide

**Before (CalendarGridView):**
```tsx
import { Calendar, CalendarGridView } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';

<CalendarGridView
  view="months"
  displayDate={displayDate}
  onMonthSelect={handleMonthSelect}
/>
```

**After (New Calendar):**
```tsx
import { Calendar } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';

// Single date selection with modern navigation
<Calendar
  mode="single"
  value={selectedDate}
  onDateSelect={setSelectedDate}
  variant="solid"
  color="primary"
  size="md"
  navigation="modern"
/>

// Range selection with dual calendar
<Calendar
  mode="range"
  rangeValue={selectedRange}
  onRangeSelect={setSelectedRange}
  numberOfMonths={2}
  independentNavigation={true}
  adjustable={true}
  draggable={true}
/>
```

## [1.0.81] - 2025-12-30

### Enhanced
- **Modal Component**: Improved vertical alignment system for modals
  - Added `verticalAlign` prop with `'center'` and `'top'` options (default: `'center'`)
  - Center alignment now uses `margin: auto` pattern for true viewport centering
  - Top alignment applies `4rem` top margin for comfortable top positioning
  - Improved scroll behavior with `overflow-y-auto` on container
  - Added `customWidth`, `minWidth`, `maxWidth` props for flexible sizing control
  - Enhanced flexbox layout with `flex-col justify-start items-center` for proper centering
  - Fixed vertical centering issue where modals could appear off-center on large screens

- **Sidebar Component**: Enhanced styling and spacing improvements (continued from v1.0.80)
  - Consistent horizontal padding `px-2` for all collapsed icons
  - Added `mx-2` margins for hover/active backgrounds in expanded state
  - Standardized all item heights with `py-3` for uniform hover backgrounds
  - Improved visual hierarchy between parent and child navigation items

- **Table Component**: Enhanced row selection and header styling
  - Improved table header background color distinction (`bg-tertiary`)
  - Enhanced row selection highlighting with better contrast
  - Consistent hover states across all table rows

### Fixed
- **Modal Component**: Fixed modal vertical centering - modals now properly center in viewport using flexbox with `margin: auto` pattern instead of fixed top margins
- **Modal Component**: Removed stray `debugger` statement from click-outside handler

### Technical Improvements
- **Modal Component**: Simplified CSS approach using inline styles for critical layout properties to avoid Tailwind safelist issues with arbitrary values
- **Modal Component**: Better separation of container and modal panel responsibilities for scroll handling

### Documentation
- **New**: Created comprehensive Modal component documentation (`MODAL_COMPONENT_USAGE_GUIDE.md`)
- **New**: Created Theme-Aware Favicon Implementation Guide (`FAVICON_IMPLEMENTATION_GUIDE.md`)
- **Updated**: VERSION_HISTORY.md with v1.0.81 changes
- **Updated**: Sidebar component documentation with latest styling improvements

## [1.0.80] - 2025-12-25

### Enhanced
- **Sidebar Component**: Comprehensive styling improvements for better visual hierarchy and consistency
  - Added indentation for CollapsibleSection children with `ml-6 pl-3` spacing
  - Fixed collapsed state icon sizing - removed double padding that compressed icons
  - SubNavItem icons now 40px (smaller than parent 48px icons) for clear hierarchy
  - Added consistent horizontal padding `px-2` for all collapsed icons
  - Added `mx-2` margins for hover/active backgrounds in expanded state for side gaps
  - Added hover styling for NavGroup header - now interactive with proper hover state
  - Standardized all item heights with `py-3` for uniform hover backgrounds
- **VirtualizedTable Component**: Improved header section rendering
  - Header wrapper now only renders when there's actual content (title, description, controls)
  - Eliminates empty space at top of table when no header content is present
- **Button Test Page**: Added comprehensive "Custom Width & Height" section
  - Examples for `customWidth`, `minWidth`, `maxWidth` props
  - Examples for custom height via `className` with Tailwind classes
  - Icon-only button sizing examples

### Changed
- **Color Tokens**: Adjusted `bg-tertiary` colors for better table header distinction
  - Light mode: Changed from `#ebeff9` to `#dce3f0` (slightly darker for better contrast)
  - Dark mode: Changed from `#1e2a3a` to `#2a3d4f` (slightly lighter for better visibility in cards)

- **Sidebar**: Improved toggle UX with sticky positioning and spacing refinements when used alongside main content.

### Improved
- **ToggleSwitch**: Controlled/uncontrolled handling refined. When `onChange` is provided, ToggleSwitch behaves as a controlled input (`checked`). Without `onChange`, it now uses `defaultChecked` to avoid React read-only warnings. Also supports `labelPosition="top"` for stacked label layout.

- **Sidebar `togglePosition`**: New positioning control for the sidebar toggle button with `top`, `bottom`, or `none`. Works with `showToggleButton` and supports sticky placement in the header/footer areas of the sidebar.

## [1.0.37] - 2025-01-28

### ðŸš¨ CRITICAL RUNTIME COMPATIBILITY FIX
- **React Version Conflicts Resolved**: Eliminated "Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'recentlyCreatedOwnerStacks')" runtime errors
- **JSX Runtime Mismatch Fixed**: Resolved JSX runtime incompatibilities between React 18 and React 19
- **Self-Contained Package**: React 19 now bundled with design system for consistent runtime behavior
- **Eliminated Peer Dependencies**: Removed peer dependency requirements to prevent installation conflicts

### ðŸ”§ Technical Architecture Changes
- **Dependency Management**: Moved React and React-DOM from peerDependencies to dependencies
- **Build Configuration**: Updated Vite config to bundle React internally instead of externalizing
- **Package Structure**: Self-contained package eliminates version conflicts with consumer projects
- **CSS Export**: Maintained CSS export functionality for proper styling integration

### ðŸ“¦ Package Improvements
- **Larger Package Size**: Increased from ~50KB to ~300KB due to React bundling
- **No More Runtime Crashes**: Eliminated JSX runtime and React version compatibility issues
- **Easier Installation**: No peer dependency warnings or version conflicts
- **Consistent Behavior**: Same React version across all consumer projects

### ðŸŽ¯ Compatibility Benefits
- **React 18+ Support**: Works with React 18.3, 19.0, and 19.1+ projects
- **No More Crashes**: Eliminated the main runtime error that was blocking consumer projects
- **Simplified Integration**: Consumers can now use components without React version conflicts
- **Future-Proof**: Ready for React 19 adoption while maintaining React 18 compatibility

### âš ï¸ Trade-offs & Considerations
- **Bundle Size**: Increased package size due to React bundling
- **Potential Duplication**: If consumer has React 19, there might be bundle duplication
- **CSS Import Required**: Consumers must import CSS from `@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/dist/style.css`

### ðŸ” Root Cause Resolution
- **Original Issue**: Design system built against React 19, consumer using React 18.3
- **JSX Runtime Mismatch**: Different React versions caused `jsxDEV` function incompatibilities
- **Solution**: Bundle React 19 with design system for consistent runtime environment
- **Result**: No more "recentlyCreatedOwnerStacks" errors or JSX runtime conflicts

---

## Versioning Strategy

- **Patch (1.0.x)**: Bug fixes, minor improvements, and documentation updates
- **Minor (1.x.0)**: New features, component additions, and API improvements
- **Major (x.0.0)**: Breaking changes, major architectural changes, and significant API overhauls

## Migration Guides

### From v1.0.30 to v1.0.31

#### Breaking Changes
- **Autocomplete Component**: Changed from `onValueChange` to `onChange`
  ```tsx
  // Old (will break)
  <Autocomplete onValueChange={(value) => setValue(value)} />
  
  // New (required)
  <Autocomplete onChange={(value) => setValue(value)} />
  ```

#### New Features
- **Alert Component**: Added `description` prop (backward compatible)
  ```tsx
  // Old way - still works
  <Alert variant="error" title="Error">
    This is the error message
  </Alert>
  
  // New way - recommended
  <Alert variant="error" title="Error" description="This is the error message" />
  ```

#### Improvements
- **Button Variants**: All button variants now have proper contrast and are fully visible
- **API Consistency**: Improved consistency across all input components

### From v1.0.29 to v1.0.30

#### New Features
- **Table Structure**: New Header, Body, and Footer section props
- **Row/Column Highlighting**: New highlighting system for tables
- **Enhanced Scrolling**: Improved horizontal scrolling behavior

#### Improvements
- **Table Alignment**: Better alignment and synchronization
- **Developer Control**: More control over table appearance and behavior

---
